alert.note: Alert for Barnes (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 8:45AM CDT until May 23 at 8:30AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota... Sheyenne River at Valley City affecting Barnes County. .Water levels continue to move higher, with a crest early this week within Moderate Flood stage. Then we should see the river start to slowly drop. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY, MAY 23... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sheyenne River at Valley City. * WHEN...Until Monday, May 23. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, MAJOR FLOOD. Levees and low spots are re-enforced. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 16.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 AM CDT Sunday was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
